result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew T. Weeden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder - Battery, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.
  • Aggravated Battery-Intend GreatBod. Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample if not previously obtained.  Pay court costs and supervision fees.  Restitution to be determined by stipulation.  No contact with the family of the victim in any way, shape or form.

While the Defendant is incarcerated, the Court orders restitution and costs taken out of his prison wages only, not from other funds that are deposited into his account beyond his DOC-issued earnings.

Consecutive to: any other sentence
Consecutive to: Count 1 and any other sentence
Consecutive to: Count 1 and any other sentence

Defendant Andrew T. Weeden in court, in custody, with attorney Philip J. Brehm. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty. B is motioning for an amendment of the complaint, in particular for the aggravated battery count to be amended to substantial battery and for the Defendant to be resentenced on that count. Counsel make their arguments for/against the motion. Court adjourns for review prior to ruling.

Court rules - the Court sufficiently found factual basis in the complaint for the second count. For a charge of aggravated battery, victim's injury can be considered an aggragate to constitute great bodily harm. Court orders the motion denied and, therefore, dismissed. DA Harper to prepare the order.
Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Testificandum

records.addlTxt: 1, 2, 4, and 5 (3 is not scanned - it has been ordered SEALED by the Court and will be stored, under seal, in the clerk's vault)
(All exhibits are stored in the clerk's vault.  Exhibit 3 has not been scanned and is under seal by order of the Court.)

Defendant Andrew T. Weeden in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Edward Covey. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  PSI corrections noted by the State and Defense.  DA offers exhibits for Court's consideration at sentencing.  Impact statements made by persons on behalf of the victim.  Statement made on behalf of the def.  DA argues State's position for sentence - asks for maximum; notes PSI from Dept. of Corrections also recommends maximum (30-year total sentence on Count 1 and 15-year total sentence on Count 2, consecutive to any other sentence).  Atty. Covey argues on behalf of the Defense, asking for less than the max (15 years incarceration for count 1 and 5 years incarceration for count 2, concurrent).  Restitution request noted and stipulated to.  Def addresses the Court. 

Court rules, sentencing def to the maximum, consecutive to any other penalty, as requested by the State and recommended in the PSI.  Count 1 - 22 years 6 mo initial confinement following by 7 years 6 months ext. supervision.  Count 2 - 10 years confinement consecutive to count 1 followed by 5 years ext. supervision, again consecutive to count 1 and consecutive to sentences already serving.  0 days credit.  Not eligible for Earned Release or Challenge Incarceration.  Felony admonishments provided.

Conditions of ES:  submission of DNA if not previously obtained; payment of costs; restitution to be determined by stipulation; no contact with family of the victim in any way, shape or form; payment of supervision fees. 

Atty. Covey states rest. approx. amount; states def is indigent; asks that JOC indicate that restitution and costs be taken from def's prison wages only.  DA takes no position on that request.  Court makes that request a provision.

Court orders Exhibit 3 sealed by stipulation.
courtroom camera request
Received from Atty Michael Covey - Eight character letters on behalf of ATW
to Transport
Sentencing hearing on December 9, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew T. Weeden in court, in custody of DCI Portage, with attorney Michael Edward Covey. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State has filed the information - count 1 of felony murder and count 2 of aggravated battery.  Discussion re max. penalties and recommendations of the State and Defense.  Parties will be asking for pre-sentence investigations including one that the Defense is paying for.  Statutory victim input through VWC Fields.  Proposed maximum sentence:  30 years total count 1; 15 years total count 2; no determination on concurrent vs. consecutive at this time.  

Court asks for def's pleas to the information as filed today.  Defense waives formal reading of the information.  Max. penalties stated; prison max count 1 would be 30 years; prison max. for count 2 would be 15 years.  Defendant pleads guilty to both charges.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.

PSI ordered through DOC.  Author to be present at sentencing.  Defense may order their own PSI; Court will not pay for that exam as Defense has indicated that it will be funding that through SPD office.  DA - State requests sentencing prior to end of the year.  Court sets 12/9 at 1:30.

Bond ordered revoked.  Def remanded to custody.
Letter from Covey Law Office - regarding writ request
Arraignment on October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew T. Weeden in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Edward Covey. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Covey informs the court that the def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  Court's colloquy with def re prelim waiver.  Waiver accepted.  Bindover ordered.  Atty. Covey waives time period for which State has to file the information; requests arraignment scheduling.  Arraignment set for Monday, Oct. 10th at 1:30.  Arraignment scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on July 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew T. Weeden in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Edward Covey. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA informs the Court that all of the discovery State has with reports have been provided; copies of photos, audiotapes, etc. are also ready for exchange.  DA asks the Court for additional status.  Atty. Covey does not object to further status; notes that def continues to be on a probation hold; recognizes this is still "pre-preliminary" hearing; states progress is being made with discovery; states probation revocation hearing is set for May 17th.  DA suggests further status July 13th; says that date has been discussed with and approved by statutory victim.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Def continues to waive time limits for prelim.  As such, Court directs next date be set as "Adjourned Initial" rather than "Status."
State
(forwarded to RCSD by clerk)
Status conference on May 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Andrew T. Weeden in court, in custody, with attorney Michael Edward Covey. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Covey waives formal reading.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties as well as his rights including right to prelim.  

Atty. Covey states defense wishes to waive prelim time limits, preserving right to have a prelim at a later date.  Counsel jointly request status scheduling in late April/early May.  DA requests status after May 2nd.  Court sets May 5th at 2:45 p.m.

DA addresses Court re bond - asks for 75k signature bond as def is presently on a P/P hold from a Rock County case, facing prison sentencing in that matter.  Atty. Covey asks for small cash bond; states rationale.  DA states she is opposed to Atty. Covey's request; notes the State opposes double credit efforts.  

Court sets bond at 50k cash.  

Status conference scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
